alert.note: Alert for Coshocton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 8:28PM EST until further notice by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Wills Creek At Cambridge affecting Guernsey County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC031-211730- /O.CON.KPBZ.FL.W.0009.000000T0000Z-000000T0000Z/ /CSHO1.1.ER.220218T0054Z.220218T1000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 828 PM EST Sun Feb 20 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River at Coshocton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water reaches low lying areas between Tuscarawas and Walhonding Rivers just upstream of the confluence of the two rivers. At 15.0 feet, Low areas are flooded and water reaches a few homes along Route 16 south of Coshocton and along County Route 1A north of Coshocton. At 16.0 feet, Flood waters begin to affect the Lake Park area along the Walhonding River and begins backwater flooding along Mill Creek north of Lake Park and along Route 83. Flood waters will begin to enter yards in low-lying areas along County Route 1A. At 18.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs along County Route 1A and lower areas along Route 16 south. Widespread flooding occurs from the Lake Park area south to near the intersection of Routes 83 and 36. Homes around North Water Street in Coshocton floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Sunday was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 16.6 feet and then begin rising just after midnight tonight. It will then rise again to 16.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall to 15.1 feet and then begin rising Tuesday evening. It will then rise again to 15.5 feet Thursday morning. It will fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 03/20/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
